pullRequest.title: Added Support for Listing Downloaded Offline Areas
pullRequest.bodyText:
Currently we just list the ID of each area. Eventually, we'll give users controls to delete and manage areas from this UI.

 Enable viewBinding.
 List Offline Areas downloaded on the device.
 Ensure list is refreshed on subsequent downloads.


towards #308
@gino-m @shobhitagarwal1612
Almost done -- just did a quick check and have to ensure the last item on the list is working.

commit.message:
Fix bug in toArea LatLngBounds call

Previously, we instantiated a new LatLngBounds instance using the latlng
values in the wrong position; this led to a bug when attempting to
convert OfflineAreaEntites back to Areas. This change fixes that issue.

See https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/maps/model/LatLngBounds
for more info.

Fetch offline areas as a Single instead of a Flowable

Since we only ever (so far) need to render the complete list of offline
areas in the db, and we don't need to convert the rx type to livedata
using from publisher, for now it makes more sense to emit the entire
list of areas as a Single (this is consistent with other implementations
in the codebase).

Add a method for retrieving all offline areas from the local datastore

We need this method to list current offline areas and allow the user to
manage or delete them.

Render lists of downloaded offline areas in the offline area ui

Eventually, we want to give users control to manage their downloaded
offline areas. This commit is the first step in toward that
functionality; it lists the current offline areas in the offline area
ui. I've also enabled viewbinding since butterknife is deprecated
(see issue #418)

Update offline area list layout

The previous sizing resulted in fairly preposterous heights.
Use get instead of iterator in Adapter.
Remove a redundant call to notifyDataSetChanged

Use Flowable instead of Single in findAll methods for OfflineAreas

This ensures we can dynamically update UIs etc. as soon as a new element
is added to the table, contrarily, Single, does not update after its
initial completion.

Update OfflineArea fragment; update list dynamically

I've updated the offlineArea fragment so that the list of offline areas
now updated dynamically according to the contents of the db. We use
Live Data now instead of a direct reference to RX types.

nodes.bodyText: Moving these two lines to the end of onCreateView would allow offlineAreaListAdapter to be declared as local variable. The adapter isn't being used anywhere else. Wdyt?
Can we use androidx.* for consistency?
As discussed on hangouts, we should call this getOfflineAreasOnceAndStream
We should avoid using single character variable name for better readability. Can you please call it binding instead?

commit.message: Don't use single letter variable names.
